metadata.Title: CVE-2018-8012 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
No authentication/authorization is enforced when a server attempts to join a quorum in Apache ZooKeeper before 3.4.10, and 3.5.0-alpha through 3.5.3-beta. As a result an arbitrary end point could join the cluster and begin propagating counterfeit changes to the leader. It was discovered that Apache Zookeeper incorrectly handled clusters. An attacker could possibly use this issue to obtain sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-8012` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libzookeeper-java - 3.4.8-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
libzookeeper-mt2 - 3.4.8-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
libzookeeper-st2 - 3.4.8-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
libzookeeper2 - 3.4.8-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
python-zookeeper - 3.4.8-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
zookeeper - 3.4.8-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
zookeeper-bin - 3.4.8-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
zookeeperd - 3.4.8-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: msalvatore> Debian notes that for wheezy (3.4.5) the "changes are too intrusive to backport"

criterions.comment: zookeeper package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.4.8-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
